text: Queen Wongyeong (29 July 1365 – 18 August 1420) (원경왕후 민씨) also known as Queen Dowager Hudeok (후덕왕대비) was born as the third daughter of Min Je from the Yeoheung Min clan and Lady Song of the Yeosan Song clan. She married Yi Seong- gye’s fifth son, Yi Bang-won in 1382 at the age of 17 making her Princess Consort Jeongnyeong of Joseon. When her husband became Crown Prince in 1400, her royal title changed to Crown Princess Consort Jeongbin of Joseon, and was eventually given the royal title of Queen Consort Jeong of Joseon in that same year. She was Queen Consort of King Taejong of Joseon, the third king of Joseon and the mother of King Sejong the Great. Her mother was given the royal title of "Princess Consort Samhanguk of the Yeonsan Song clan" (Hangul: 삼한국대부인, Hanja: 三韓國大夫人), and her father was given the royal title of "Internal Prince Yeoheung, Min Je" (Hangul: 여흥부원군 민제, Hanja: 驪興府院君 閔霽). Queen Wongyeong is described as smart and ambitious and with an astute political ambition, who frequently intervened in state affairs. She assisted her spouse in his way to the throne and convinced him to appoint their eldest son Yangnyeong as crown prince. When he replaced their son as crown prince with the son of a concubine, Queen Wongyeong was enraged and her interference finally resulted in King Taejong executing her younger brothers in order to keep her and her family's ambition in check. Royal Noble Consort Hyobin of the Cheongpung Kim clan was originally one of Queen Wongyeong's servants at the Min household before she became a concubine for King Taejong, and Royal Noble Consort Shinbin of the Yeongwol Shin clan was also originally one of Queen Wongyeong's retinue of assistant court ladies. == Family == * Great-Great-Grandfather ** Min Jong-yu (민종유, 閔宗儒) (1245 - 1324) * Great-Great-Grandmother ** Lady Yu (유씨, 兪氏) * Great-Grandfather ** Min Jeok (민적, 閔頔) (1270 - 4 March 1336) * Great- Grandmother ** Lady Won (원씨, 元氏) * Grandfather ** Min Byeon (민변, 閔忭) (? - 1377) * Grandmother ** Lady Heo of the Yangcheon Heo clan (본관: 양천 허씨, 陽川 許氏) * Father ** Min Je (閔霽) (1339 - 1408) * Mother ** Lady Samhanguk of the Yeonsan Song clan (삼한국대부인 三韓國大夫人) (? - 1424) * Brothers ** Older brother: Min Mu-gu (민무구, 閔無咎) (? - 1410) ** Older brother: Min Mu-jil (민무질, 閔無疾) (? - 1410) ** Older brother: Min Mu-hyul (민무휼, 閔無恤) (? - 1416) ** Older brother: Min Mu-hui (민무회, 閔無悔) (? - 1416) * Husband ** King Taejong (태종, 太宗) (13 June 1367 - 30 May 1422) * Sons ** Yi Je, Prince Yangnyeong (이제 양녕대군, 李禔 讓寧大君) (1394 - 1462) ** Yi Bo, Prince Hyoryeong (이보 효령대군, 李補 孝寧大君) (1396 - 1486) ** King Sejong the Great (세종대왕, 世宗大王) (1397 - 1450) ** Yi Jong, Prince Seongnyeong (이종 성녕대군, 李褈 誠寧大君) (1405 - 1418) ** Unnamed prince (1412 - 1412) * Daughters ** Princess Jeongsun (정순공주, 貞順公主) (1385 - 1460) ** Princess Gyeongseong (경정공주, 慶貞公主) (1387 - 1455) ** Princess Gyeongan (경안공주, 慶安公主) (1393 - 1415) ** Princess Jeongseon (정선공주, 貞善公主) (1404 - 1424) == Titles == * 29 July 1365 - 1382: 1\. Lady Min (민씨, 閔氏) 2\. Daughter of Min Je * 1382 - 1400: Her Highness, Princess Jeongnyeong of Joseon (정녕옹주, 靖寧翁主) * 1400: Her Highness, Crown Princess Consort Jeongbin of Joseon (정세자빈, 貞世子嬪) *1400 - 1418: Her Majesty, Queen Consort Jeong of Joseon (정비, 靜妃) *1418 - 18 August 1420: Her Majesty, Queen Dowager Hudeok of Joseon (후덕왕대비, 厚德王大妃) * Posthumous title: Queen Wongyeong of Joseon (원경왕후, 元敬王后) ==Popular culture== * Portrayed by Kim Young-ran in the 1983 MBC TV series The King of Chudong Palace. * Portrayed by Choi Myung-gil in the 1996-1998 KBS TV series Tears of the Dragon and in the 2008 KBS TV series The Great King, Sejong. * Portrayed by Kang Se-jung in the 2014 KBS TV series Jeon Do-jeon. * Portrayed by Im Ye-jin in the 2015 MBC TV series Splash Splash Love. * Portrayed by Gong Seung-yeon in the 2015-2016 SBS TV series Six Flying Dragons. * Portrayed by Kim Sa-hee in the 2015 film Empire of Lust. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Joseon Dynasty people Category:1365 births Category:1420 deaths Category:14th-century women Category:15th-century women Category:Royal consorts of the Joseon Dynasty Category:Yeoheung Min clan
